Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; discoloured white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres above two white bands; exterior: reserved with painted inscription.
Curator's comments: Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim; several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. 'A921' is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 252, no. 7)
Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 166, no. 44)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 319)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pp. 16, 51, pl. V, no. 37)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1826) (phase 2)
